text.headline: Overview
text.text:
The Lightning Network is a scaling solution for Bitcoin, based on payment channels. While the latter were already conceived by Satoshi Nakamoto, the Lightning Network and its key components arose from the Bitcoin community itself, with many people sharing their thoughts and ideas along the way.

This timeline aims to summarize the corner points of the development of the Lightning Network from the release of its White Paper up to the present state of the network.

media.caption: Joseph Poon presenting the ideas of the paper in March 2015

text.headline: "The Bitcoin Lightning Network" paper released
text.text:
Joseph Poon and Thaddeus Dryja release the paper which later on would often be referred to as the Lightning Network white paper.

While the paper was published as work in progress, the proposed use of Hashed Timelock Contracts for routing payments over multiple channels turned out to be a game-changer.

text.headline: Most recent version of paper released
text.text: The paper "The Bitcoin Lightning Network" got released in its most recent form, namely the DRAFT Version 0.5.9.2

media.caption: The 'How Will I Know' video showcases the youthful energy that boosted Houston to stardom.

text.headline: Debut
text.text: Whitney Houston's self titled first release sold over 12 million copies in the U.S. and included the hit singles 'How Will I Know,' 'You Give Good Love,' 'Saving All My Love For You' and 'Greatest Love of All.'

media.caption: Dionne Warwick gleefully announces cousin, Whitney Houston, the winner of the Best Female Pop Vocal Performance for the song Saving All My Love.

text.headline: 'The Grammys'
text.text: In 1986 Houston won her first Grammy for the song Saving All My Love. In total she has won six Grammys, the last of which she won in 1999 for It's Not Right But It's Okay.

text.headline: 'Whitney'
text.text: Multiplatinum second album sells more than 20 million copies worldwide. With 'Whitney', Houston became the first female artist to produce four number 1 singles on one album including "I Wanna Dance With Somebody,' 'Didn't We Almost Have It All,' 'So Emotional' and 'Where Do Broken Hearts Go.'

media.caption: "One Moment In Time" - Theme song to the 1988 Seoul Olympics

text.headline: "One Moment In Time"
text.text: The artist's fame continues to skyrocket as she records the theme song for the Seoul Olympics, 'One Moment In Time.'

text.headline: Bobby Brown
text.text: Houston and Brown first meet at the Soul Train Music Awards. In an interview with Rolling Stone Magazine, Houston admitted that it was not love at first sight. She turned down Brown's first marriage proposal but eventually fell in love with him.

media.caption: CNN looks back at Houston's iconic performance of the national anthem at Superbowl XXV.

text.headline: Super Bowl
text.text: Houston's national anthem performance captures the hearts and minds of Americans ralllying behind soldiers in the Persian Guf War.

text.headline: "The Bodyguard"
text.text: Houston starred opposite Kevin Costner in the box office hit, The Bodyguard. The soundtrack to the movie sold over 44 million copies worldwide  garnering 3 Grammy's for the artist.

media.caption: Bobby Brown performing "My Prerogrative," from his "Don't be Cruel" solo album. Bobby Brown first became famous with the R&B group, New Edition.

text.headline: Married Life
text.text:
After three years of courtship, Houston marries New Edition singer Bobby Brown. Their only child Bobbi Kristina Brown was born in 1993.

In 2003 Brown was charged with domestic violence after police responded to a domestic violence call. Houston and Brown were featured in the reality show, "Being bobby Brown," and divorced in 2007.

text.headline: Crack is Whack
text.text: Houston first publicly admitted to drug use in an interview with Diane Sawyer. The singer coined the term "Crack is Whack," saying that she only used more expensive drugs.

media.caption: Addiction expert, Dr. Drew, talks about Whitney's death and her struggle with addiction.

text.headline: Rehab
text.text: Houston entered rehab several times beginning in 2004. She declared herself drug free in an interview with Oprah Winfrey in 2009 but returned to rehab in 2011.

text.headline: Being Bobby Brown
text.text: Being Bobby Brown was a reality show starring Brown and wife Whitney Houston. Houston refused to sign for a second season. A clip of her telling Brown to "Kiss my ass," became a running gag on The Soup.

text.headline: A Rocky Comeback
text.text: Houston's comeback tour is cut short due to a diminished voice damaged by years of smoking. She was reportedly devastated at her inability to perform like her old self.

media.caption: Houston, performing on Good Morning America in 2009.

text.headline:
Whitney Houston
1963-2012
text.text: Houston, 48, was discovered dead at the Beverly Hilton Hotel on on Feb. 11, 2012. She is survived by her daughter, Bobbi Kristina Brown, and mother, Cissy Houston.
